intro: Cirrhaea obtusata, commonly known as the bluntleaf cirrhaea, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetlands. Cirrhaea obtusata is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining wetland ecosystems.
